title: Systems of Linear Equations
description: Solve systems of linear equations using substitution, elimination, and graphical methods with real-world applications.
subject: Mathematics
achievementDescription: Successfully solve systems of equations using multiple methods

text.introduction: A system of linear equations consists of two or more linear equations with the same variables. The solution is the point where all equations intersect - the values that satisfy all equations simultaneously. These systems model many real-world situations where multiple constraints must be satisfied.

sections.title: Understanding Systems of Equations
sections.content:
**What is a System?**
A system of linear equations looks like:
• x + y = 5
• 2x - y = 1

The solution is the ordered pair (x, y) that makes both equations true.

**Types of Solutions:**
• **One solution:** Lines intersect at one point
• **No solution:** Lines are parallel
• **Infinite solutions:** Lines are identical

sections.title: Substitution Method
sections.content:
**Steps for Substitution:**
1. Solve one equation for one variable
2. Substitute into the other equation
3. Solve for the remaining variable
4. Back-substitute to find the other variable

**Example:** Solve x + y = 7 and 2x - y = 2
• From equation 1: y = 7 - x
• Substitute: 2x - (7 - x) = 2
• Simplify: 2x - 7 + x = 2 → 3x = 9 → x = 3
• Back-substitute: y = 7 - 3 = 4
• Solution: (3, 4)

sections.title: Elimination Method
sections.content:
**Steps for Elimination:**
1. Align equations vertically
2. Multiply to make coefficients opposites
3. Add equations to eliminate one variable
4. Solve for remaining variable
5. Substitute back to find other variable

**Example:** Solve 3x + 2y = 13 and x - 2y = 3
• Add equations: (3x + 2y) + (x - 2y) = 13 + 3
• Simplify: 4x = 16 → x = 4
• Substitute: 4 - 2y = 3 → y = 0.5
• Solution: (4, 0.5)

sections.title: Graphical Method
sections.content:
**Graphical Approach:**
1. Graph both equations on the same coordinate plane
2. Find the intersection point
3. The coordinates of intersection are the solution

**Advantages:**
• Visual representation of the problem
• Easy to see if solutions exist
• Good for understanding the relationship

**Disadvantages:**
• May not be exact for non-integer solutions
• Time-consuming for complex systems

questions.question: Solve using substitution: x + y = 8 and x - y = 2
questions.explanation: From the second equation: x = y + 2. Substitute: (y + 2) + y = 8 → 2y = 6 → y = 3, x = 5.

questions.question: Which method is best for the system: 3x + y = 10 and 3x - y = 2?
questions.explanation: Elimination is best because the y-coefficients are opposites, making elimination immediate.

exercises.title: Mixed Methods Practice
exercises.instructions: Solve these systems using the most appropriate method for each.
exercises.hint: Choose substitution when one variable has coefficient 1, elimination when coefficients can be easily made opposites.

exercises.title: Ghana Business Problems
exercises.instructions: Set up and solve systems of equations based on Ghanaian business scenarios.
exercises.hint: Define your variables clearly and identify the two relationships in the problem.

scenarioChallenges.title: Ghana Market Vendor Problem
scenarioChallenges.scenario: Ama sells oranges and bananas at Makola Market. On Monday, she sold 20 oranges and 30 bananas for GH₵25. On Tuesday, she sold 15 oranges and 20 bananas for GH₵18. She wants to know the price per fruit.
tasks: Set up a system of equations for this problem
Solve to find the price of each fruit
Calculate Ama's revenue if she sells 25 oranges and 35 bananas
learningObjectives: Translate complex word problems into systems
Use solutions for prediction and planning
scenarioChallenges.ghanaContext: Makola Market in Accra is one of West Africa's largest markets, where vendors use mathematical skills daily to manage pricing and profits.
